thread.title: Plano man gets 40-year sentence for human trafficking
thread.title_full: Plano man gets 40-year sentence for human trafficking

author: Valerie Wigglesworth
title: Plano man gets 40-year sentence for human trafficking
text:
Plano man gets 40-year sentence for human trafficking Filed under Plano at Get Daily Dallas News Headlines Sign Up 
A Plano man was sentenced to 40 years in prison after a Collin County jury found him guilty this week of human trafficking. 
Johnta Silverburg, 41, was convicted on a charge of continuous trafficking of persons. Johnta Silverburg 
According to prosecutors, Silverburg met his victim online in 2011 and forced her to work as a prostitute. The victim testified she was allowed to leave home only to work as a prostitute and had limited access to money. She was also the victim of threats and multiple assaults. 
"Silverburg targeted and exploited a vulnerable woman for his own financial gain," District Attorney Greg Willis said in a news release. "Sex trafficking won't be tolerated in Collin County." 
The case was investigated by the Texas Department of Public Safety's Human Trafficking Task Force based in Garland. View Comments
